no_user_banned_from_command: No user banned for the **{0}** command.
no_command_banned_for_users: No banned command for these users.
no_command_banned_for_user: No banned command for this uses.
user_already_registered_birthday:
You already registered your birthday.
*If you made a mistake, ask a mod to reset your birthday.*
user_birthday_reset: {0} has been removed from the birthday database.
gallery_channel_set: Gallery requests will be displayed here.
cog_birthday_description: Register and wish the birthday of users.
cog_welcome_description: Manages the posting of a mesage in a set channel when a role is taken
cog_bancommand_description: Prevents users or roles to use a bot command
cog_roleDM_description: Manages the sending of a private message when a role is taken
help_global_field_general_value:
- `-help <CogName>` - Displays help for the specified cog
- `-load <CogName>` - Loads specified cog ( :white_check_mark: )
- `-unload <CogName>` - Unload specified cog ( :x: )
help_global_description: *This bot is split into several **cogs**. Select wich help you want to display.*
cog_utip_description: Manages role giving for Utip backers"
cog_source_description: Monitor channels for attachment files and ask source
cog_rules_description: Warn a user by sending them a DM about a rule when reacting to their messages
help_help_general:
- `-help <NomDuCog>` - Show help for specified Cog
- `-load <NomDuCog>` - Load specified Cog ( :white_check_mark: )
- `-unload <NomDuCog>` - unload specified Cog ( :x: )
help_moderator_only: *This Cog command's can only be used by an authorized moderator or admin*
help_help_description: *This bot command's are separated in **Cogs**. Choose which help you want to see*
help_vote_admin_command_phase:
- `!closeproposition (cp) <MessageID>` - Closes the proposition phase. No `addproposition/editproposition/removeproposition` will be allowed anymore from non moderating users.
- `!closepedit (ce) <MessageID>` - Closes the moderation phase. No `addproposition/editproposition/removeproposition` will be allowed anymore.
- `!closevote (cv) <MessageID>` - Closes the vote phase. No vote wil be allowed anymore.
 `!closepropositionat (cpa) <MessageID>` - Closes the proposition phase at the specified date. No `addproposition/editproposition/removeproposition` will be allowed anymore from non moderating users after the set date.
- `!closevoteat (cva) <MessageID>` - Closes the vote phase at the specified date. No vote will be allowed after this date.
- `!resetvote (rv) <MessageID>` - Resets the vote phase for a vote (put all votes back to 0).
help_vote_admin_command_config:
- `!createvote (vote) [<title>]` - Create a vote embed with a title.
- `!setdescription (setdesc) <MessageID>` - Sets vote description.
- `!settitle (title) <MessageID>` - Sets vote title.
- `!setvotetype (svt) <MessageID> <votetype>` - Sets the vote type (vote by default). `votetype` is a character string without spaces.
- `!setvoterole (svr) <MessageID> <role>` - Sets the role to be warned when the proposition phase ends.
- `!setvotechannel (svc) <MessageID> <channel>` - Sets the channel to be used to warn about when the proposition phase ends.
help_vote_user_command:
- `!addproposition (add) [<MessageID|votetype>]` - Add a proposal to an ongoing vote with matching MessageID, votetype or first compatible vote found.
- `!editproposition (edit) [<MessageID|votetype>]` - Edit a proposal from an ongoing vote with matching MessageID, votetype or first compatible vote found. No comfirmation will be asked.
- `!removeproposition (remove) [<MessageID|votetype>]` - Remove a proposal from an ongoing vote with matching MessageID, votetype or first compatible vote found. No comfirmation will be asked.
help_vote_description: :warning: MessageID is referecing to the the vote embed message ID.
help_ban_admin_command:
- `!bancommanduser <command> <user> [<time>]` - Prevents user to use a command for the `time` duration or permanently if not specified.
- `!unbancommanduser <command> <user>` - Allow again user to use a command.
- `!isbanuser <user>` - Displays commands that are banned for the user.
- `!listbanuser [<command>]` - Displays banned users for each command or a specific command.
- `!bancommandrole <command> <role> [<time>]` - Prevents a role to use a command during `time` duration or permanently if not specified.
- `!unbancommandrole <command> <role>` - Allow again role to use a command.
- `!isbanrole <role>` - Displays commands for wich role is banned.
- `!listbanrole [<command>]` - Displays banned role for each command or for a specified command.
- `!help bancommand ` - Displays this message.
help_ban_description: This cog is only available to allowed roles.
help_welcome_admin_command:
- `!setwelcomechannel (swc) [<channelID>]` - Sets the welcome channel (if no ID specified = current channel).
- `!setwelcomemessage (swm) <RoleID>` - Sets the welcome message for the specified role.
- `!setwelcomerole (swr) <RoleID>` - Sets a role to trigger the *Public Welcome*
- `!updatewelcome (uw)` - Register the welcome parameter for all roles and users that already have a role triggering the public welcome.
- `!clearwelcome (cw) [<user>]` - Resets the welcome information for a sepecified user or self if no user specified.
help_welcome_variable:
- `$member` - mention the user that triggered the *Public welcome*
- `$role` - mention the role that triggered the *Public welcome*
- `{ }` -  mark the begining and end of the randomness inside the message
- `|` - marks the separation between the random arguments
help_invitation_general:
- `-setgallerychannel (-sgc)` - Sets current channel for user token requests.
- `-cleanchannel (-cc)` - *to use in the channel specified for token/invitation requests* - Deletes all channel messages except the pinned ones
- `-help invitation` - Displays this message - *do not use it in public channels*
help_invitation_suf:
- `-setinvitechannel (-sic)` - Sets current channel for user to request invitations.
- `-setinvitelog (-sil)` - Sets current channel for the invitation logs.
- `-inviteuser (-iu) <UserID>` - Sends an invitation to the specified user (or the author if no user specified).
- `-resetinvite (-ri) <UserID>` - Resets the timer in between 2 messages to 0 for the specified user (or the author if no user specified).
help_invitation_ar:
- `-setgallerychannel (-sgc)` - Sets current channel for token requests from users.
- `-setgallerylog (-sgl)` - Sets current channel for token logs.
- `-token  <UserID>` - Sends a token to specified user (or to command author if no ID specified).
help_utip_admin_command:
- `!setutipchannel (suc) [<channel>]` - Sets the moderation channel for Utip.
- `!setutiplog (sul) [<channel>]` - Sets the channel for Utip logs.
- `!setutiprole (sur) <role>` - Sets the backers role to give.
- `!setutipmessage (sum)` - Sets the message to be sent after the Utip request.
- `!setutipdelay (sud)` - Sets the delay for the Utip role to be kept.
- `!help utip` - Displays this message.
help_utip_user_command: - `!utip` - posts a request for the Utip role. The bot will ask you for the necessary attachments in the channel.
help_roleDM_admin_command:
- `!setroledm (sr) <role>` - Sets a role to trigger the bot.
- `!unsetroledm (ur) <role>` - Remove role from the trigger role list.
- `!setroledmmessage (srm) <role>` - Sets the message to send when the role is taken.
- `!displayroledmmessage (drm) <role>` - Displays current message for the role if set.
- `!help roledm` - Displays this message.
help_roleDM_description: This cog is only available to allowed roles.
help_birthday_admin_command:
- `-setbirthdaychannel (-sbc) <channelID>` - Sets a channel for birthday wishes.
- `-setbirthdaylog (-sbl) <channelID>` - Sets a channel for birthday logs.
- `-resetbirthday (-rb) <memberID>` - Deletes a member from the birthday database so they can reset or correct their birthday.
help_birthday_user_command: - `-setbirthday (-bd)` - Sets the birthday of a user. Format **DD/MM**
help_nickname_admin_command:
- `resetnickname (-rn) <UserID>` - Reset nickname timer for specified user.
- `setnickcd (ncd)` - Sets delay between 2 nickname changes (fromat DHMS).
- `getnickcd` - display the delay between 2 nickname changes
- `setnicknamelog (snl)` - Sets current channel to display logs for nickname changes.
help_nickname_user_command:
- `nickname/pseudo <wanted nickname> ` - Sets user nickname for this server.
- `next ` - Displays the time remaining before the next available nickname change.
- `help nickname ` - Displays this message.
help_source_admin_command:
- `-addsourcechannel (-asc)` Add a channel to monitoring list
- `-removesourcechannel (-rsc)` Remove a channel from monitoring list
- `-setsourcemessage (-ssm)` Set the message displayed when asking for source
 - `-listsourcechannels (-lsc)` List monitored channels
help_rules_admin_command:
- `{0}addrule (adr)` - Add a new rule and its **unique** trigger emoji. The emoji must be available for the bot.
- `{0}editrule (edr) <emoji>` - Edit the rule linked to the emoji.
- `{0}removerule (rmr) <emoji>` - Remove rule linked to the emoji.
- `{0}listrules (lrs)` - List previously set rules and emoji.
- `{0}setruleslog (srl) [<channelID>]` - Set a channel to display Rules' logs.
- `{0}rule (r) <emoji>` - Display the rule linked to the emoji.
- `{0}help rules` - Display this help message.
help_rules_variable:
- `$member` - mention the user that has been warned
- `$message` - mention the message that has been warned
- `{ }` -  mark the begining and end of the randomness inside the message
- `|` - marks the separation between the random arguments
help_logs_general: - `-setnicknamelog (-snl)` - Sets current channel as log channel for nicknames.
help_logs_suf: - `-setinvitelog (-sil)` - Sets current channel as log channel for invitations.
help_logs_ar: - `-setgallerylog (-sgl)` - Sets current channel as log channel for tokens.
cog_source_description: Cog for asking the source of an attachment

help_source_admin_command:
- `{0}addsourcechannel (asc) [<channel_id>]` - add current channel or channel_id to source monitor list
- `{0}removesourcechannel (rms) [<channel_id>]` - remove current channel or channel_id to source monitor list
- `{0}setsourcemessage (ssm)` - Set message to post when source is asked
- `{0}listsourcechannels (lsc)` - list source-monitored channels
- `{0}adddomain (adm) [<domain>]` - add domain to blacklist
- `{0}removedomain (rmd) [<domain>]` - remove domain to blacklist
- `{0}listdomains (lsd)` - list blacklisted domains
- `{0}help source ` - show this message
